required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on February 08, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: County-wide Emergency Personnel Assessment of COVID-19 and Influenza Status

brief_summary.textblock:
Study Objectives:
To perform COVID-19 diagnostic and serologic testing on emergency medical personnel in Polk County to determine:
1. COVID-19 prevalence
2. Rate of convalesced personnel (+antibodies)
3. Rate of asymptomatic carriers

detailed_description.textblock:
This observational study involves a community wide program offering free COVID-19 testing to county front line workers, including EMS personnel, board of county commissioners and sheriffs' office personnel. These personnel will also be asked to fill out a survey that asks about their medical history and which of any symptoms they have experienced in the prior three weeks. The survey is voluntary and written informed consent is obtained . EMS personnel can still get the free testing even if they do not want to fill out the survey.
The primary objective of the study is to describe the prevalence of COVID-19 antigen and IgM and IgG markers amongst our county/EMS workers.
The secondary objective is to describe whether the antigen/antibody markers are significantly correlated to the presence of a set of symptoms in the prior 3 weeks, and/or to the baseline demographics such as age, sex, and presence of co-morbidities.

primary_outcome.measure: Prevalence of COVID-19 amongst county emergency personnel
primary_outcome.description: To assess the prevalence of COVID-19 amongst county emergency personnel

secondary_outcome.measure: Correlation of common COVID-19 symptoms with result of COVID-19 test
secondary_outcome.description: To correlate common COVID-19 symptoms with result of COVID-19 test

secondary_outcome.measure: Co-existence of influenza and COVID-19 positive test results
secondary_outcome.description: Co-existence of influenza and COVID-19 positive test results with or without symptoms

intervention.intervention_name: COVID-19 antigen and antibody tests, and influenza rapid test
intervention.description: Study volunteers will be offered free COVID-19 and influenza testing and the opportunity to complete an electronic survey about any symptoms.

study_pop.textblock: Volunteers of Polk County (FL) emergency personnel

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
Polk County (FL) emergency personnel including EMS, Fire Rescue, Board of County Commissioners, and Sheriff's office
Exclusion Criteria:
Age < 18
